body:
Concept ACK, guess this could go to doxygen as well:
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/doc/developer-notes.md#doxygen-comments

On Mon, Dec 12, 2016 at 5:42 PM, Russell Yanofsky <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> ------------------------------
> You can view, comment on, or merge this pull request online at:
>
>   https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9333
> Commit Summary
>
>    - [trivial] Add comment documenting CWalletTx::mapValue
>
> File Changes
>
>    - *M* src/wallet/wallet.h
>    <https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9333/files#diff-0> (20)
>
> Patch Links:
>
>    - https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9333.patch
>    - https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9333.diff
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you are subscribed to this thread.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9333>, or mute the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AGGmvwyHw-ubxSXuULI1M21IhefCtm8Rks5rHXl8gaJpZM4LKwdn>
> .
>
New commit 87ed396159974b403d0ac00cb793888174e2665c adds documentation for bumpfee mapvalue entries (added in #8456)

diff_hunk:
@@ -248,6 +248,28 @@ class CWalletTx : public CMerkleTx
     const CWallet* pwallet;
 
 public:
+    /**
+     * Key/value map with information about the transaction.
+     *
+     * The following keys can be read and written through the map and are
+     * serialized in the wallet database:
+     *
+     *     "comment", "to"   - comment strings provided to sendtoaddress,
+     *                         sendfrom, sendmany wallet RPCs
+     *     "from", "message" - obsolete fields that could be set in UI prior to
+     *                         2011 (removed 4d9b223)
body: 4d9b223 is the commit hash? github's UI can't find it. If it is commit hash, please add by/in before the ID.

     const CWallet* pwallet;
 
 public:
+    /**
+     * Key/value map with information about the transaction.
+     *
+     * The following keys can be read and written through the map and are

+     *
+     *     "comment", "to"   - comment strings provided to sendtoaddress,

+     *                         2011 (removed 4d9b223)
+     *

+     *     "version"         - serialized nTimeSmart value

@@ -248,6 +248,28 @@ class CWalletTx : public CMerkleTx
     const CWallet* pwallet;
 
 public:
+    /**
+     * Key/value map with information about the transaction.
+     *
+     * The following keys can be read and written through the map and are
+     * serialized in the wallet database:
+     *
+     *     "comment", "to"   - comment strings provided to sendtoaddress,
+     *                         sendfrom, sendmany wallet RPCs
+     *     "from", "message" - obsolete fields that could be set in UI prior to
+     *                         2011 (removed 4d9b223)
+     *
+     * The following keys are serialized in the wallet database, but shouldn't
+     * be read or written through the map (they will be temporarily be added and
+     * removed from the map during serialization):
+     *
+     *     "fromaccount"     - serialized strFromAccount value
+     *     "version"         - serialized nTimeSmart value
+     *     "n"               - serialized nOrderPos value
+     *     "timesmart"       - serialized nTimeSmart value
+     *     "spent"           - serialized vfSpent value that existed prior to
+     *                         2014 (removed 93a18a3)

@@ -248,6 +248,28 @@ class CWalletTx : public CMerkleTx
     const CWallet* pwallet;
 
 public:

body: Hmm, search can't find it, but it is hyperlinked to https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/4d9b223ac2b596d93ef772fea27b75d1b959b9ae 8). Interesting. Looks like bug in github's search? ;-)

+     *

body: utACK - though would prefer to just remove this unnecessary code instead of bother to document it here

diff_hunk:

     const CWallet* pwallet;
 
 public:

+     *     "timesmart"       - serialized nTimeSmart value
+     *     "spent"           - serialized vfSpent value that existed prior to

body: Ok, added another commit to this PR which removes the mapValue.erase("version") statement and this part of the comment.
